frontmatter.title: How React Rendering Works - A Step by Step Guide
frontmatter.description: Although what react is doing looks quite complex, underlying logic is very simple. And the easiest way to understand is just running some simple examples. We’ll dive into how react renders components and updates the actual DOM.

frontmatter.title: Creating a unified Formik input field to support all input types seamlessly
frontmatter.description: We are going to create a single component that supports text, textarea, select, radio, and checkbox. It will absorb all implementation differences for different inputs and will allow us using a unified component in our Formik forms.

frontmatter.title: What happens when you hit google.com using HTTPS
frontmatter.description: While making a simple request to https://google.com to see that simple search page, there are a lot of things going on behind the scenes to keep you secure. Understanding this flow will give you a lot of confidence in various topics like Digital Certificates and Signatures, Symmetric/Asymmetric key encryptions, Certificate Authorities and how they all work together to help you have secure communication.

frontmatter.title: Web security unknowns: Same-origin Policy
frontmatter.description: Attacks like CSRF or XSS are still not clear to many of us. It is not because they are super hard to understand, but it requires some basic understanding of concepts like SOP, CORS, CSP, HTTPS. Let's start with what's Same-origin Policy

frontmatter.title: Indexing DynamoDB Items to ElasticSearch using AWS Lambda
frontmatter.description: DynamoDB is Amazon’s NoSQL database which offers single-digit milliseconds latency. It is great for variety of use cases, but when you need to run complex search queries on your dataset, you quickly realise it is not designed for it.

frontmatter.title: Going Serverless Offline
frontmatter.description: In this post, we are going to setup an environment with API Gateway, Lambda and DynamoDB using serverless framework which can be deployed to AWS directly or run fully local.
